title: New Safety Rules Could Force Tesla to Redesign Its Door Handles
description: Tesla’s flush, retractable door handles, a key part of the brand’s minimalist design, could soon face major changes. titleSummary: "Tesla May Be Forcing a Fresh Design on Its Vulnerable Door Handles"
descriptionSummary: Tesla's sleek door handles, a hallmark of its futuristic aesthetic, may be on the verge of an overhaul as regulatory bodies globally scrutinize their electronic operation in light of recent reports of malfunction.

title: Alfa Romeo Recalls Over 62,000 Cars - Less Than A Month Since Its Last Major Issue
description: Another blow for Alfa Romeo as they announce a recall of Giulia and Stelvio models from 2020 to 2025, due to a malfunctioning rearview mirror that does not display correctly.
titleSummary: "Alfa Romeo Faces Latest Worry as Massive Recall Affects Tens of Thousands of Vehicles Again"
descriptionSummary: Alfa Romeo faces another setback with a voluntary recall affecting certain Giulia and Stelvio models from 2020 to 2025, stemming from an issue with the rearview mirror's camera feed failing to display properly.

title: SPIED: Bentley’s Electric SUV Gamble Starts to Take Shape

title: New Camaro Trademark Filing Suggests Chevy’s Sports Car Isn’t Done Yet
description: It was the end of an era for Chevrolet in late 2023 when the final, sixth-generation Camaro rolled off the production line. As the Dodge Challenger's departure leaves it the sole survivor among classic pony cars, whispers hint at a potential revival for this iconic American icon.

description: A year after Elon Musk first showed off the Cybercab, Tesla’s all-electric, fully autonomous two-seater is back in the spotlight, and apparently, it’s gotten way better. title: Jeep Levels Up Grand Wagoneer to Rival the Cadillac Escalade
description: Earlier this month, we heard that Jeep would be consolidating the Wagoneer and Grand Wagoneer lineups: Due to pricing overlap and customer confusion, all Jeep’s full-size SUVs would fall under the Grand Wagoneer nameplate for 2026. title: Kia’s EV5 Won’t Be Sold in the U.S. After All
description: When Kia announced the EV5 back in July, it was introduced as a global model slated for rollout in China, Korea, Europe, and North America. title: The US is Adding EV Chargers at a Record Pace
description: Even as Americans lose access to the federal tax credit for buying electric vehicles, the nation’s charging network is expanding at a record pace. About 780 public high-speed charging stations opened across the U.S. in the third quarter — the largest single-quarter jump on record, according to ...

title: You’re Subsidizing New Car Sales Every Time You Pay for Repairs
